articles.headline: For ‘Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell,’ Split on Party Lines
articles.snippet: The dispute underscores the continuing power of social issues — like gay rights and abortion — in each party’s nominating contest.
articles.abstract: The dispute underscores the continuing power of social issues — like gay rights and abortion — in each party’s nominating contest.

articles.headline: Rise in China’s Pork Prices Signals End to Cheap Output
articles.snippet: Rising prices are causing Chinese companies to raise prices for exports, particularly on one critical commodity: pork.
articles.abstract: Rising prices are causing Chinese companies to raise prices for exports, particularly on one critical commodity: pork.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAOYAO, China, June 1 — Few things are as essential to the Chinese as their pigs.

articles.headline: Turkey Rattles Its Sabers at Militant Kurds in Iraq
articles.snippet: In an effort to root out Kurdish separatist guerrillas, Turkey is stepping up its presence along its border of Iraq.
articles.abstract: In an effort to root out Kurdish separatist guerrillas, Turkey is stepping up its presence along its border of Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: CIZRE, Turkey, June 7 — Turkey is stepping up its presence along its border with Iraq to levels not seen in years in an effort to root out Kurdish separatist guerrillas who take refuge in northern Iraq.

articles.headline: One City’s Home Sellers Do Better on Their Own
articles.snippet: Home sellers in Madison, Wis., did not get higher prices for their homes using real estate agents, a study concluded.
articles.abstract: Home sellers in Madison, Wis., did not get higher prices for their homes using real estate agents, a study concluded.
articles.lead_paragraph: It sounds like the setup for a dull economist’s joke. Who gets the better deal: the cautious economist who sells his house through a real estate agent, or his risk-taking colleague who finds a buyer on his own?

articles.headline: Yields on Treasuries Climb; Shares Tumble Again
articles.snippet: Anxiety over the potential for higher inflation, driven by a strong global economy, is preoccupying investors.
articles.abstract: Anxiety over the potential for higher inflation, driven by a strong global economy, is preoccupying investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not long ago, Wall Street trembled when it looked as if the slowing American economy might be getting worse. But now, anxiety over the potential for higher inflation, driven by a strong global economy, is preoccupying investors.

articles.headline: Putin Surprises Bush With Plan on Missile Shield
articles.snippet: After months of angrily rejecting a White House plan for missile defense in Europe, the Russian president offered to build a joint system in Azerbaijan.
articles.abstract: After months of angrily rejecting a White House plan for missile defense in Europe, the Russian president offered to build a joint system in Azerbaijan.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROSTOCK, Germany, June 7 — After months of angrily rejecting a White House plan for missile defense in Europe, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia surprised President Bush on Thursday with an offer to build a joint system in the former Soviet Republic of Azerbaijan.

articles.headline: Putting the We Back in Wii
articles.snippet: Nintendo has changed its strategy in an effort to dominate the newest generation of video game consoles.
articles.abstract: Nintendo has changed its strategy in an effort to dominate the newest generation of video game consoles.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO, June 7 — If there is a secret to the smash success of Nintendo’s Wii video game console, it may be this: even the creative loner can benefit from having friends.

articles.headline: Candidates’ Tax Plans Are a Mystery
articles.snippet: If any of the presidential candidates are thinking seriously about tax reform, they have kept the information to themselves. And that is a pity.
articles.abstract: If any of the presidential candidates are thinking seriously about tax reform, they have kept the information to themselves. And that is a pity.
articles.lead_paragraph: Opportunities for real tax reform are rare. But when they do come along, something good can happen only if political leaders are prepared with a plan they can sell to a populace that knows the shortcomings of the present system but is suspicious of changes that may cost them money.

articles.headline: Patent Ruling Strikes a Blow at Qualcomm
articles.snippet: The U.S. International Trade Commission ordered a ban on Thursday of some imported cellphones with Qualcomm chips that infringe on a Broadcom patent.
articles.abstract: The U.S. International Trade Commission ordered a ban on Thursday of some imported cellphones with Qualcomm chips that infringe on a Broadcom patent.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, June 7 — Millions of new mobile phones containing certain Qualcomm semiconductors could be barred from import into the United States under a ruling issued Thursday by a federal government agency in a patent dispute.
